title: Contribute
text: py/ghe_extract: general python library using llama_cloud_services extract JSONs pdfs produce flat CSV py/: ORD specific files containing schemas describing extracted variables main.py used execute extraction R/: contains code clean flattened JSON resulting extraction

title: Contribute
text: Place ORD - YYYYMMDD.zip files raw/ run: script create raw/ORD_files following tree structure: containing docs zip files
code: ./unzip.sh ORD files ├── Contribute │   ├── Tilley │   │   ├── application │   │   └── final report │   ... ├── Establish └── Explore

title: Contribute
code: python3 -m venv venv source venv/bin/activate pip install -r requirements.txt

title: Contribute
text: Get API key : https://cloud.llamaindex.ai/login

title: Contribute
text: Either environmental variable LLAMA_CLOUD_API_KEY edit main.py pass LlamaCloudExtractor(api_key='') run main code

title: Contribute
text: Delete files: command delete pdfs dir recursively

(Examples: FALSE, NA) ethics_personal_data_import_switzerland Indication whether personal data imported Switzerland research project, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA) ethics_personal_data_criminal Indication whether personal data related criminal records collected used research project, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA) ethics_animals Indication whether animals used research project, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, TRUE) ethics_activities_outside_switzerland Indication whether research activities conducted outside Switzerland, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA, TRUE) ethics_outside_countries_ethics_issues Indication whether ethical issues related activities conducted countries outside Switzerland, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA) ethics_local_resources Indication whether local resources utilized research project, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA) ethics_environmental_harm Indication whether research project poses risk environmental harm, represented categorical value. (Examples: FALSE, NA, TRUE) ethics_human_harm Indication whether research project poses risk harm humans, represented categorical value. title: application_metadata: ETH Board Open Research Data (ORD) Program Project Metadata and Report Data — application_metadata
application_metadata: ETH Board Open Research Data (ORD) Program Project Metadata and Report Data — application_metadata
text: data frame 76 rows 15 variables: project_id Unique identifier research project within ETH Open Research Data dataset. (Examples: EXPLORE/NMRPRIME, CONTRIBUTE/CATCHARACTPROVI, CONTRIBUTE/THRACE) project_category Classification research project based purpose funding type. (Examples: Contribute, Establish, Explore) main_applicant_institution Institution main applicant associated research project. (Examples: Eawag, EPFL, Empa) main_applicant_function Position role main applicant within institution. (Examples: Prof, Professor (Prof. Dr.); Senior Scientist, Senior Researcher / Lecturer) main_applicant_first_name Given name main applicant associated research project. (Examples: Esther, Isaac, Elizabeth) main_applicant_surname Family name main applicant associated research project. (Examples: Rieckermann, Paradis, Holmes-Gentle) main_applicant_laboratory_name Name laboratory associated main applicant research project. (Examples: NA, Robotic Systems Lab, Chair Space Geodesy) main_applicant_postcode Postal code main applicant's address. (Range: 1015 9014) main_applicant_city City residence main applicant associated research project. (Examples: Dübendorf, Birmensdorf, Villigen PSI) project_title Title research project describing focus objectives. (Examples: BRAINSCOREHUMAN – Making Brain Behavior Data Accessible Modelling via Brain-Score, DaTabases fRont-end wEb-bAsed Software performance-based natUral hazaRds Engineering, MMS (Masonry MicroStructures database) - 3D masonry microstructures database advancing numerical research irregular stone masonry structures) project_acronym Abbreviated identifier research project, typically representing full title. (Examples: THRACE, BOSTORD, OpenSense) project_abstract Summary research project outlining objectives, methods, significance. (Examples: OPEN-ACTRIS project aims explore build FAIR data chain standards strategies atmospheric observations collected Switzerland part Aerosol, Clouds Trace Gases Research Infrastructure (ACTRIS). ACTRIS pan-European network aims deepen understanding climate change air pollution producing high-quality data short-lived atmospheric constituents. ACTRIS-Switzerland multi-institutional Swiss node network. ACTRIS comprehensive vision FAIR data covers stages research data life cycle definition data levels covering raw measurements, processed data, elaborated data products. OPEN-ACTRIS project aims implement ORD concepts ETH domain explore best ORD practice within ACTRIS-Switzerland combining existing tools infrastructure ETH domain ACTRIS community. achieve building FAIR data chains aerosol observations continuously recorded field measurement stations Jungfraujoch Payerne, aerosol gas measurements performed campaign-basis PSI Atmospheric Chemistry Simulation Chambers., Mobile ground robots become increasingly popular academia various industrial applications. However, unlike domains like aerial robotics, autonomous driving, construction, currently high-quality, large-scale dataset reliable benchmark established field, tooling available . Creating dataset immensely valuable researchers developers fostering research robust practical algorithms across diverse environments. Moreover, development standardized benchmarking platform promote fair comparisons different approaches, fostering innovation facilitating rapid progress mobile ground robot research. Motivated , propose collect share high-quality, versatile, large-scale robotic dataset, “GrandTour”, scalable automated tooling– focusing legged robots addition set benchmarks necessary tooling., reusability particle physics analyses severely affected undocumented manual steps taken analysis teams. Starting typically centrally produced reusable data sets, high-level physics analyses largely performed using individually developed analysis scripts frameworks. analysis code commonly version control git repository, guarantee works yields results obtained manual execution. project aims provide prototype solution issues experiments performed PSI Laboratory Particle Physics (CMS, Mu3e, n2EDM) encoding missing information directly code repository integrating execution environment ensure code’s functionality. achieved providing templates automatically test code package self-contained portable software container images code repository server. container images distributed compute clusters using technology allows massively parallel batch processing. Aiming excellent user experience increase adoption, setup builds upon existing infrastructure PSI benchmarked optimized potential future large-scale deployment. Dedicated documentation developed, training course held PSI, results well lessons learned presented international computing workshop.) start_date Date research project scheduled commence, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. (Examples: 2023-02-01, 2025-01-06, 2023-10-01) project_duration_months Duration research project measured months. (Range: 4 36) total_budget_requested Total budget amount requested research project measured Swiss Francs. (Range: 15000 1500000)

report_metadata: ETH Board Open Research Data (ORD) Program Project Metadata and Report Data — report_metadata
text: data frame 63 rows 10 variables: project_id Unique identifier research project within ETH Open Research Data dataset. (Examples: CONTRIBUTE/TIMERESHDRMX, ESTABLISH/PREMISE, CONTRIBUTE/GPM-API) project_title Title research project outlines objectives scope. (Examples: Explore AiiDA Regional Inverse Modelling Greenhouse Gases, Building Open-Source Tools reproducible interaction biological ORD databases, XYT : raw GPS data Mobility analysis) explore_call_number Identifier specific call research project submitted, represented numeric value. (Examples: 6, 5, 0) project_starting_and_end_date Start end dates research project formatted YYYY-MM-DD. (Examples: 2023-09-01/2025-02-28, 2023-05-01/2025-06-30, 2023-03-01/2024-08-31) main_applicant_responsible_for_project Name main applicant responsible overseeing research project. (Examples: Marco Hutter, Esther Frei, Serina Robinson) function Job title role individual within research project. (Examples: Professor, Senior Scientist / Teamleader, Photon Science Division) laboratory_department Department unit within institution research project conducted. (Examples: RU Forest Resources Management, Laboratory Waste Management, Center Imaging) institution_of_main_applicant Name institution affiliated main applicant research project. (Examples: Geological Institute, Paul Scherrer Institute PSI, Paul Scherrer Institute) report Classification type report associated research project. (Examples: Final, , Intermediate) reporting_period Timeframe project activities reported, formatted start date/end date. (Examples: 2023-05-01/2024-07-31, 2025-04-01/2025-03-31, 2022-10-01/2023-09-30)
